Y-w3PYIdvPLcncMy0Kt2iA.text: I was planning to attend a conference in Pittsburgh and was researching food joints that I wanted to check out. A friend of mine insisted that I go to Pierogies Plus telling me that the food was so good that ever since he went that he has had pierogies mail-ordered to his house each year. While I have never been a huge fan of pierogies, I figured that I should heed my friends advice since he generally steers me to places I enjoy. Let's just say in this case, he hit the ball out of the park.  I actually wound up going to Pierogies Plus straight from the airport. After getting in a rental car and plugging in my GPS, imagine my surprise when my GPS announced "You have reached your destination." and I found myself sitting outside what appeared to be an old service station. When I walked inside and up to the counter, I found a crew of Polish women rocking out every kind of Pierogi imaginable. I was overwhelmed by the sheer volume of choices.  Wanting to try everything, I wound up going with their Sampler Platter #1 which was a small haluski (a noodle and cabbage mixture), a stuffed cabbage, and four pierogi ( I wound up going with a potato with bacon, potato with cheese, potato with jalapeno, and potato with meat). The food was outrageously good. I'm actually salivating just thinking back on the meal. The stuffed cabbage was not marred by the typical dryness that can afflict that dish and was perfectly sauced. The haluski, a dish I had never heard of, was amazing.  While I can't expect everyone to make their way to Pittsburgh solely to go to Pierogies Plus, do yourself a favor and order some. Those wonderful ladies deserve your business. Your belly will appreciate it!

j5KvRxcWKoo_YAEt-8UKpQ.text: This little former gas station makes some incredibly delicious pierogies. Order ahead for big holidays - we order several dozen every year for Easter and the take out line stretches out the door all day on Good Friday. I particularly like the apricot and cream cheese and the prune varieties. Potato and cheddar are great, too, of course!

wfXXxiB-gayNP-hfN08ZKg.text: Pierogies Plus has the most amazing customer service I have ever encountered  I wanted to send my sister, who lives in Pittsburgh, a care package after she had a bad fall. I normally put together my own, but I was too busy, and I wanted to make sure it was just as special. The wonderful people at Pierogies Plus made sure my sister had a delicious surprise, and they were wonderful and kind every time I called.  My sister and brother-in-law raved over the pierogies, and my sister was absolutely delighted by the dessert apricot ones! (They received them fresh the evening they were made, and then froze the rest -- fresh and frozen were both delish!) I cannot recommend this place enough!  TLDR: Go buy your pierogies here!

Ts2oxpJzKfgI4-5MKS5XUw.text: Apricot with cream cheese, who would have thought...love this place, love it so much.  Print the 10% off coupon on their website before going in.   Make sure u print it out, they will not accept it other wise.

PiREuwJQSLJQ2F5s-CdExg.text: I was very disappointed in the quality of the pierogies and the haluski at Pierogies Plus.  I ordered them hot and I purchased enough so that I could have leftovers the next day.  When I got home and opened the containers, something smelled odd.  When I started to eat, it tasted just as odd.  As it turns out, what is referred to as 'butter sauce' is a misrepresentation of what it really is-----margarine, which I eliminated from my diet years ago because of the trans fats and the fact that any way you cut it, butter makes for a better product.  Sorry Allison B, ain't no butter here.  Margarine is used as a cost-cutting measure, and it just can't measure up.  I rinsed off the peirogies and browned them in some butter and my own onions.   The haluski got thrown away.  For the prices being charged for these products, the proprietor can well-afford to use butter.

IHX3EdH7HqUF0SiM_V2q2g.text: Just finished a dinner of pierogies that our Pgh family brought to WV - always look forward to Pierogies Plus - try the apricot for a sweet treet!

bB4YXjUOcVhKterpR9kZDA.text: OMG good pierogis in a classic blue collar 'hood. At first glance, it looks like a place to get a flat fixed on your tire. Instead, I re-learn why I always avoid the corporate food franchises and seek places like this out. Just go there and eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to! It's well worth the mapquest ...

lbIFnsshXiOVorNp1jAi8g.text: Love butter? Then get thee to Pierogies Plus.  I live in St. Louis, and it seems like the only pierogi I can find are in my grocer's freezer. Oh, but when I go home to Pittsburgh, I can have as much of the chewy, flavorful, buttery goodness as I desire from Pierogies Plus.  The place still looks like an old service station with a tiny building and a roof over an old gas pump island. Inside, though, magical elves... uh... I mean fabulous Polish women... create deliciousness with love -- and butter. Have I mentioned that butter is a part of the deal? Because it totally is. You really should fast for two days before picking up pierogi from here.  Oh, but you'll be happy you did. I'm vegetarian, so I only order meat-free pierogi. I'm in love with the saurkraut and the cheese varieties. When you pick up a hot order, you'll get your pierogi covered in with rich butter and sauteed onions. No, I'm serious -- the pierogi are SWIMMING in butter. It's the best thing ever. Everything is packed inside a styrofoam container and a plastic bag, because butter WILL spill out.  You also can order cold or frozen pierogi if you plan to, say, lug them to the middle of the country to enjoy in a far-off city.  Besides many varieties of pierogi, you also can get things from the deli cases. Last time, I had some apricot blintzes, a latke and some type of apple turnover thingy. I really hope Pierogies Plus has the blintzes when I visit next.  Awesome thing: Pierogies Plus usually has coupons in the Entertainment Book. My best friend and I steal all of the coupons from our families so that I can get a steady stream of discounted Polish goodness each time I visit.  The only downside is that Pierogies Plus often closes for several days around holidays. I totally understand it -- family time is important! -- but that often coincides with my visits (I head east around the holidays mainly because I get an extra day with the fam without having to take another vacation day). I've learned to plan my trips around the Pierogies Plus schedule, though, because I MUST have yummy goodness. A pierogi-less Allison is a cranky Allison.

a7DpxbI8GEqEcNb1VegvJQ.text: As a skeptical out of towner, I was pretty wary after the hotel bellhop suggested this off the beaten path place. However this place far exceeded my expectations. We bought an assorted dozen of pierogies and they were all delicious (my favorites being the jalapenos pierogi and the bacon/potato pierogi).  A great find and an excellent place for someone out of town to try out pierogies!

I3LBGhX78RlCn1E8X029tQ.text: You have never had a pierogie until you've driven out to McKees Rocks and picked up a dozen or so from Pierogies Plus. Made primarily by Polish and Ukranian immigrants, these are probably the most authentic/delicious pierogies you can buy in the states.   If the only pierogies you've ever had were the frozen Mrs. T's you got at Giant Eagle, do yourself a favor and check Pierogies Plus out.

0FfWRModZo_NZPOkxcSXMg.text: Recently spent time in my hometown and ordered a plethora of pieroghi and haluski for a dinner gathering at home. I purchased several types -- potato and cheese, meat, spinach, as well as apricot-filled and prune-filled pieroghi. They were all delicious, but I most love the spinach and prune ones! I lightly pan-fried them before serving and didn't add much butter.  You're not going to find a restaurant takeout that's more quintessentially 'Pittsburgh', than this place! Featured in July's edition of Budget Travel magazine, as a recommended place to try. Enjoy!!!!

U_ELZNe_nMFMH1v1m4hMmw.text: Traditional, tasty, fabulous.  Order pierogies cold or hot for a buck or two more.  They always carry 4 main types of pierogies, with about 25 other kinds you can special order.  There is always a line, which says enough.  I never get tired of their halupki either.  If you can deal with the billy graham leaflets and focus on the food, you'll come out a winner.  Oh yeah, if you can, ask for the senior discount!

1TZ367_PvP585J3mZbpoYw.text: These pierogies are one of my favorite things in the world. They're freakin' amazing. The potato and jalapeno ones are my favorite. And I definitely think it's worth it to drive all the way out to McKees Rocks to get them. I like to get them frozen, and bring them home and smother them in butter.

3iBD4E6O36gvXYGj60wAFQ.text: Their pierogies are famous and for good reason. You can get them frozen to-go or served hot and drenched in butter and sweet onions. I tried the meat, the potato and cheese, and the cottage cheese and chive pierogies but my favorites were the potato and cheese ones. I'm glad I did not leave Pittsburgh without having some of their pierogies. It was well worth getting lost trying to find this place. They were featured on FoodTV, too!

kBYcHrcoHLcGmqG1z73Ndw.text: Well for my first time here I was way less than impressed. The lady at the front counter was a crab and  the Pierogies really weren't that great. Rather than be kind and answering my questions I settled with the potato and cheese pierogies. I guess Bloomfield Bridge tavern or Mrs. T's is still my go to place. And plus this place is way out of my way to be treated poorly. I wouldn't go back

UScpcz3BWHfUgJ_t7e_0vg.text: My mother is 80+ years old and now lives in New York but she grew up outside of Pittsburgh.  Her parents were Czech and our annual vacations to visit my grandparents were wonderful - filled with family dinners including stuffed cabbage, peirogies, and haluski.  Now that my mother is older and lives alone making things like stuffed cabbage is difficult for her.  I saw Peirogies Plus featured on the Food Network years ago and decided to send my mom an assortment for her birthday.  When her package arrived she called me immediately and said "Where did you get this food???".  This is the real deal - traditional, authentic, ethnic food.  The gift I sent took my mother back to her own mother's kitchen.  It's the comfort food to beat all comfort foods - it also takes me back to my childhood all those summers ago!  I'm ordering again for my mother's birthday.  The only "problem" now is that I have to order enough to include my brothers and sisters who mysteriously show up at my mother's house once the rumor that the package has arrived makes the rounds.

M9pfmfhaBRu7_9TpmAyERA.text: The perogies have always been good but their customer service is horrible.  Almost every year we place a larger order for holidays and every year they make some mistake on the order.  This year was enough.  They lost my phoned in order for the 2nd time in a row and were rude about it telling me there was nothing they could do.  I willl never order from them again.

v7zodBoVwscf3Kogduf8EQ.text: These are the best pierogies EVER!  My favorite is the jalapeno pierogie, which is not that spicy, but has excellent flavor.  It is such a treat to get these when I'm back in town!

MZZqa7LtW1-WCDwQCuELcA.text: In Pittsburgh, there IS no other place to get pierogies. Everything is made by hand, fresh every day. And the mix of languages while you wait is a real treat! There are over 30 kinds of pierogies and now that they have expanded, there are a variety of salads and some desserts available too. Don't forget about the haluski and stuffed cabbage! They've been on the Food Network with Bobby Flay, Food Finds, Dave & Dave from WQED, and in numerous newspaper articles. You won't find anything more authentic or delicious as this place. And they ship too!

L9p1H5m0XXE1J1u04ksdZw.text: Best pierogies I've ever had.  And, seeing as how I'm from Pittsburgh.... that's a lot.  The apricot and cream cheese pierogies are amazing!!!  GO.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. A bit of what Pierogies Plus offers.

YNmnQyAPD-LQN-Zqlm8kMg.text: I love these. I would eat the whole dozen in one sitting if I could. The apricot cream cheese ones are delicious!

Jv3mVIuD6U97QTJNab63OA.text: Yummy! I've never tried Polish food aside from a sausage. I have to say it was really good. The ladies that worked there were very nice. The only down side it took a while to get my food. I think it's made to order. Regardless, when I received my food it was streaming hot. Let's just say for me it was worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Yum!

0fFw5YZMGW1JqT1xasEF7Q.text: Whoa! There is a reason why these pierogies continue to win awards in Pittsburgh. I decided to stop in while traveling through the Rocks and was very pleased with my decision. The place itself isn't meant for sitting and dining but rather some quick carry out or pickup. I noticed they had a special on sandwiches for 6 bucks that came with either Haluski or Pierogies for an additional 2.50. Ithought I would jump on the deal as I try to be frugal when I can and I like trying different things. My hot sausage sandwich was fantastic. This is a sandwich I don't normally crave but when done right it can be quite satisfying. The bun was the perfect mix of soft and firm and the sausage had a great snap to it. The peppers were pretty good as well. I chose to go with cheese and potato as my side. The cashier was very friendly and my order was prepared quickly. I was given a to go container with three pierogies swimming in some type of onion butter sauce. The noodles were super fresh and soft and the potato filling tasted like fresh mashed potatoes. I smashed this meal quickly and was tempted to go back to try the haluski and some of their dessert pierogies. If you like pierogies you gotta check this place out!

_tE_kj1Lo-AYTSYokQJcKw.text: This was recommended to me after taking my daughter to a play in the area yesterday. I live in the South Hills, so don't go over to McKees Rocks much, but it is worth a trip. Some of the best pierogis I have had in the area. Reminded me of church fair stuff from when I was a kid. The range of flavors is impressive.  We'll be back!

l-N-m8kKCdWw4oc9lteWlw.text: Have been getting pierogies from pierogies plus for over a year now.  They are authentic and delicious.  You can tell these pierogi makers are well trained!  I have always purchased the standard potato, potato and cheese or potato and sauerkraut. They are all amazing!  If I could remember to call ahead, I would love to try their specialties.   It does get crowed so plan ahead and order ahead before holidays.

IuKzPborK0WNVYYJUrRIyQ.text: On our first visit to Pittsburgh we were on a mission to try all of the Pierogie we could find. Having a Polish heritage, I grew up making these with my grandma and continue the tradition of making them with my kids now. The staff here was wonderful. It was such a hot day in July and the gal behind the counter swapped the mailman the mail for an ice cold bottle of water. That says a lot for the kind of people in charge. The menu consisted of all the foods I grew up eating so we settled on a sample platter. Everything was wonderful. The potato and kraut were my fav. Will be back for sure!

B5bxH_T5wzYn3VonyrwTqw.text: The amount of food in the box was crazy I think it could have easily fed two people. The pierogies are on point. I had potato and cheese and loved them!!! No place to eat so its a to go place but well worth it. Glad we stopped on on our way to Pittsburgh!!! Would go back

68ypGjGq00dA9zGCLa6cCQ.text: This place has some amazing homemade pierogies! I had never eaten anything besides the usual Mrs. T.'s potato types and boy, was I missing out! We stopped one night and got a some potato/cheddar and some sauerkraut/potato. You can buy them hot or take them home cold. There is a small table outside to eat, but only standing room to order inside.  They had special order pierogies that sounded amazing, but they suggest a 2 day advance order for those. They said sometimes they will have leftover specialty ones for sale, but it all depends on the day.   They also have haluski, stuffed cabbage and other things that I am looking forward to trying next time.

ZCKqtpmWUtDnrUg3WlTd0w.text: Some great pierogies are expertly handmade with "tender loving care," here in this once-was-a-gas-station. Quality, I tell you. They're definitely worthy of a pierogi pilgrimage.   Order them hot if you want them right then and there because these nice ladies also sell them cold to take home too.   Hot and buttery, buttery, buttery, and covered in sauteed onions is how you'll get them. So good. We shared the potato and cheese, potato and sauerkraut, and hot sausage varieties. Delicious, them all.

2KS5YqjB0uK9WWKT-JdBWg.text: I've never stopped into Pierogies Plus... had my husband order take out and  bring it home to WV....ohhh my!!! Even cold, this is the best meal I've had in a long time! I had the special #1 with the best haluski ...ever... along with the cabbage roll that tastes like my Slovak grandma, and 485511the pierogies are just fantastic...  I will be ordering this and having this for the new year..WOW!! ....and PS, the portions ... enough for dinner, and lunch the next day!!

HB0NhOk8Xw4Kx_6HRnVXYg.text: We went way out of our way on a long road trip to stop here, and it was worth it. It's just one of those funky little neighborhood spots that does a great job at its specialty. Ordering was a little awkward but we got through it. We didn't mind sitting in the crappy little outdoor seating area--it was better than getting back in the car.

3_WTeqKVTCtDBvtGQEq_Wg.text: Best pierogies I've have ever had..and I've been eating church-made pierogies since I could chew. How these people can take simple flour, eggs butter onions and mashed potatoes and make them into such an exquisitely tasting dumpling is beyond me. Every other place in and around the city that I've tried doesn't even come close to pierogies plus. Don't waste your time or money anywhere else. Pure perfection.

7O1D7UCv2aNX_JxvWqlTUg.text: WARNING: ADDICTING POTATOE VERSION OF CRACK -----CHEAP, frozen, cold or hot.  PARKING SUCKS on busy route 51 mckees rocks only enough room for approx 6-8 cars. SUPER BUSY best time to come is between 1pm-4pm------g8 food.  Outside in good weather there is a couple little tables to sit at., but not during the winter/early spring.  MOST CUSTOMERS ARE TO GO TAKE HOME . hours monday 11-6, tues-friday 11-7 -----   closed sat/sun

rIaCQKtqQ9KtpORsvp0_ow.text: Good pierogies, but after also having Szmidts in Greenfield recently, this place takes the backseat. Its also out of the way for me. However, if I ever happen to be in McKees Rocks, Ill make sure to keep this spot in mind.

qGVxtCc1-AflRpULrA0R5g.text: Update: Get. The. Italian. Sausage. Pierogies. Holy crap. It will change your freaking life!

qi6IgRunikEsjI2Au1Xg5Q.text: Go hungry!!  The meals are huge!  We found this place before we visited the Pittsburgh area and wanted to add it to our list of places to eat.  We were only doing mom and pop type restaurants for our vacation, no major chain restaurants.  This place fit the bill perfectly!  Like I said the meals are huge and delicious.  We got there right before closing but they still served us with a smile.  We had the #2 and the #7, both were yummy.  Those pierogies couldn't have had any more filling in them, they are packed with goodness.  This was the first time we have ever had Haluski, it was awesome.  We also had the nut horns for dessert.  Buy some for the car ride home!  There are a few seats outside the shop but it is mostly carry out.  Also don't let the neighborhood scare you, the food is worth it!!

c5k-Ianlh7VLS_75G7mR9Q.text: Little ladies, sitting in the back of a renovated gas station perched precariously at the top of a hill, making pierogies and cooking them to perfection in butter and onions... it almost sounds like a strange Pittsburgher fairy tale, but this is no tale - the finest pierogies I've ever eaten emerge from the back of that gas station, and my Polish girlfriend even confirmed that these are better than some of her family's goods.  While in line I met folks from Rhode Island, Kentucky, and North Carolina, who all had come to McKees Rocks in their rental cars straight from the airport before even going to see their families - that is dedication and commitment to some seriously delicious pierogies. After enjoying a dozen of these filling, savory, perfect pierogies, I think once I move away from here I will be making that same trip to Pierogies Plus myself.

1MCWYcDuDD6sXTLPzX4BjA.text: I went back again just to relive the great flavors.  My opinion is still the same; The best Pierogies I have ever tasted.  I tried the Reuben Pierogies...they were amazing.  I order a large quantity online and freeze them.  Worth every penny!

_48B_0cZftegRWucd4EOcw.text: Sorry just had my first taste of Pierogies Plus. We had the potato cheese I would like to know where the cheese was? The potatoes tasted very bland almost like dried mixed. Not my cut of tea.

ixjf7JSJFpFiNRw-ywvVyA.text: Out and about at lunch... decided to stop and grab something to eat.    There was a nice selection of hot and ready pierogis to choose from which was nice and there were a few available behind the counter "cold".  Most of the specialty type pierogies require special orders (potato and meat etc.)  I had a meatball sandwich for $5.50 and it was tasty. It was the size of a half meatball hoagie.   The woman that waited on me said that the meatballs were homemade.    Of course I had to get some delicious Pierogies.. "Potato and Cheese (submerged in butter and onions).  I took them back to the office and shared.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Meatball Sandwich ..
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Potatoes and Cheese Pierogies ... in butter and onions

-RapZlyDq-lrZFT-WHl28g.text: Visited Pierogies plus while in town. The service was fast and efficient and those pierogies were to die for! They are lot bigger than I'm used to in my neck of the woods.    You will find Pierogies Plus off the main road- it's a bit hidden off the road.   They have a great selection of different pierogies but we went with the potato and kabasi as well as the stuffed cabbage. The stuffed cabbage was out of this world, the meat and sauce inside was very nicely done, the flavors were perfect - you can tell it was made with love. The pierogies were also very good and filling.   The shop has some cool memorabilia on the walls of famous chefs, and newspapers articles written about Pierogies Plus and their owners. Definitely worth checking out!

IPw8yWiyqnfBzzWmypUHgg.text: If you are looking for the best pierogies in Pittsburgh, this is your place. There are a few small tables outside but most of the business is carry out. Pierogies Plus wins Best Pierogies every year. Why? Because the owner is from Poland and she is making the real deal pierogies. The best part is that they are hand pinched by a group of older Polish and Hungarian women.  The biggest seller is potato and cheese but they sell many flavors. They are like plump pillows of softness. You can buy them buy the dozen. You can get them cold to take home and freeze or warm and ready to eat. The warm ones are served with butter and onions.  It's definitely a comfort food. The best part is that they ship internationally. Yes, they are that good.

XuRRSuWyZpH6PKzL4-xrag.text: Visited Pierogies Plus for the first time on a recent visit to Pittsburgh after seeing the restaurant featured on Andrew Zimern's  show. I had the lunch special: a polish kielbasa with sauerkraut and 3 pierogies: potato, potato and cheese and ground meat. The sandwich was tasty, but the star of the lunch were the pierogies and the kind and knowledgeable employees; who served me and provided me with shipping menu's to bring home, so I can continue to enjoy these little tasty gems of quality made with love the traditional way.  Before I left I was graciously introduced to the owner and because I was so pleased with the pierogies I bought some frozen "Angels" (miscellaneous variety of broken pierogies) to bring home with me.   A must try when visiting Pittsburgh.

vyWCBDyqbsrhtBkCJisV3g.text: Awesome pierogies! We had the potato cheese and sausage. So tender and tasty. We enjoyed ours at the tables outside. The haluski was also very good.

Yw7gnxy6eWjWwLMa0G7RIA.text: Decent pierogies but not the best I've had. I've eaten @ Pierogies Plus two times. Both times I got the potato & cheese pierogies. They are good however they come in WAY too much butter/oil. They are probably soaked in at least a half a cup or more of butter/oil. When I get them I have to take them out of all the butter/oil b/c it would make me completely sick if I ate them as is. Other than that the pierogies themselves are decent.  However, they are pretty pricey. About $12 for 1 dozen.  Recommend eating here if you're passing through or nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Potato &amp; cheese (too much butter/oil)

Yq1fTk3ejnnU4W8GePsM2w.text: I have been a pierogies lover for over three decades and it is always a hunt to find a good source because I have so many allergies.  But I recently discovered Pierogies Plus and it has been a God sent.  I have had about 15 dozen shipped to me so far and I can honestly say I could eat their pierogies every day of the week. The best I have had to date. Thank you, ladies, for your wonderful contribution to excellent food services.  Keep up the great work and I will be a forever loyal customer.

4eX4iZKhEaIARyj3DfvwKQ.text: This is awesome! First time having pierogies on visit to Pittsburgh, thanks to yelpers we found this little shack full of buttery potato goodness!!  Come and try, you won't be disappointed!  Yum!!

tsrFCqyxvX20UMzj_Z0OYw.text: This place is absolutely amazing!! What a great find! The pierogies are incredible! The sandwhiches are wonderful!! The service is great and the prices are very fair! This is a must try if in the area!!

PazvSoMjl48LZEnMZYzh3g.text: hard to say anything other than...............................simply the best.  NOTHING fancy, just great food at a very reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States

8tuyu5V72UIn8ZE-XlYDXQ.text: We ate here on a trip to Pittsburgh and were blown away by how delicious everything was. You get cray huge portions for a very reasonable price.  We had traditional pierogies with potatoes and cheese and an order or cabbage which was not only delicious but was enough for both of us to eat for 2 meals. I had a crab cake as well which was also very tasty.  We were lucky enough to grab a seat out front to enjoy our meal and then packed the rest to take home. I will definitely be back when I am in the area!

_uOxrsJb__1Fj_L6a867kA.text: Being from Pittsburgh originally, and now live in Seattle, I make it a point to get my pierogie fix here at Pierogie Plus when in town visiting.  The ladies working here are always very kind and service is quick.  The pierogie's... silky dough pillows filled with delicious potatoes and cheese and finished with melted butter and onions.  Ohh my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  If your visiting or live in Pittsburgh, definitely make this a stop in your ventures.  You won't be disappointed.  Be sure to check the business hours before you go.  Open at 11a.

bSNx4iPgdsCn3Xubn_EpyQ.text: Best pierogies in tahn!    I usually just go with the standard potato and cheese but I've also tried a few of the other pierogies and some of the plus.  These pierogies can't be beat.  Made by hand with love in the traditional old world style, I have yet to find better.  It's amazing to get there at 10:55am, 5 minutes before they open and see the mad rush of people getting pierogies.  By 11am, the line is already out the door.  Always a good sign.  They serve their pierogies hot, cold or frozen.  I always go with the hot because nothing beats pierogies bathing in butter and onions.  And here at Pierogies Plus, they are definitely worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Potato and Cheese

mrvZfZfuxTXkmB62YhCHwg.text: Have really been missing home and recently had pierogies and haluski shipped all the way to Alabama. Shipping costs were pretty substantial, and the cooling system was VERY borderline in terms of how long it lasts, but everything looked so amazing that I was willing to chance it. :) Price wise, I think shipping is absolutely worth it as along as you order two or more of everything. Everything was so great--maybe even better than my Busha used to make! Will definitely be ordering again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Finally some good food in Alabama.

Je2Y2mzQZxJXfeUYPCUROQ.text: Love this place!! I am from a Russian-Polish background. And while no one made pierogis like my grandmother, these are next best thing. Authentic and delicious. We love the meat, potato, and potato-sauerkraut ones. I am used to the cheese ones being a bit sweeter so it was not my preferred pierogi, but it was not bad. The stuffed cabbage was great. For desert we had a poppyseed cake which we loved and devoured half of. We will definitely come back. Of note, better to take-out food. We saw limited outdoor seating only.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Sampler platter #1. Delicious!!

VfVHVF3d9ShOgZKS9Jo6lw.text: My experience:  went there for Pierogies for Christmas. They are taking no more orders and you might stop and get lucky if daily orders aren't filled. So I stopped in. Immediately the lady said ' we have no Pierogies left for sale'. I replied okay. So while standing there a gal can in w/two others. She asked 'any Pierogies' and a different gal answered ' sorry we're sold out'. So the customer said to friends 'guess we're Eaton Arby's'. Just then the sales gal said what did you want?  Lady replied 'we wanted some to eat now'. The sales gal replied 'well I could do two dozen'. Meanwhile I just asked to buy some. This place is obviously operated by morons. They can keep their slimy bland crap Pierogies and stick where the sun don't shine. They aren't that great anyway just a time saver. Plenty of others that are better. So shove it P!!

W3N2VDYr1tAP1D7Fw3HC8w.text: Best pierogies I've had. Ok, so parking and seating is limited, but you'll get over the small stuff once you've eaten here. Potato and cheese pierogies is what I ordered. Just go here. Made by some darn good polish cooks!  Go here! Do it!!

ZXWBMOiUzMhLRyXE-U-7ng.text: Another one of the Pittsburgh areas hidden gems. Pierogis Plus has cornered the market with their amazing traditional dishes from Poland and Central Europe, I've discovered lots of local restaurants carry them and serve them like Pirogies Plus or their own style.   Delicious pillow shaped pirogies are sold by the half dozen or dozen either hot or cold. Cold, are chilled but not frozen packaged to take home. Hot are swimming in butter steaming hot turns into instant comfort food.  Traditionally filled with potato, sauerkraut, cheese and minced meat, they also have hot sausage, jalapeno potato and bacon or great combos you can custom order like sauerkraut with kielbasa.  Other great dishes like stuffed cabbage, haluski noodles and lots of other items not on the menu is the result of a bunch of mothers and grandmothers are confined to a kitchen and creating great food.

PQE-xX0rcGlCGde-xfSrhw.text: Great pierogies and haluski.  A bit pricey for what you get and their deals for bulk orders are not great compared to other places (for example, Gosia's is better and will give you a deal on a big order).  Pierogies Plus is not the best pierogies in the city--keeping in mind there's a lot of competition here--but they definitely are the best Polish food in the McKees Rocks area.  The main reason that I deducted a star is because every staff member there has been incredibly rude over the phone or in person.  I got yelled at by a staff person once when I rather meekly pointed out their website prices did not match their in-store prices--not my fault the website was not up-to-date.

56I_V3bG1nFzeppacOzkTA.text: This place was really good.  Ordered the sampler plate with one small haluski, one stuffed cabbage, four pierogies. I have to admit the haluski was EPIC!!! OMG THE BEST I WAS LIKE WHAT AM I EATING!! SOOOO FREAKIN GOOD!!  The pierogies and the stuffed cabbage wasn't as amazing, but it was tasty. The crab cake was nasty. Yuck!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Crab cake
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. one small haluski, one stuffed cabbage, four pierogies

rJdWXtUEUtdr1HVtJMo0jQ.text: I have loved the food at Pierogies Plus for a number of years. After today's experience, I am even more blown away by how cool a place this is! I ordered online since I'm in the middle of a big work project and couldn't get out. The delivery came in good time and before I could even look in the bag, I got a phone call from Monica informing me that it was the wrong order. Long story short, Monica went above and beyond to correct the error and I was blown away by the customer service. Not only will I order again, but I'm having my entire office do so with me! Thank you Monica and Pierogies Plus!

kdazz2ItrzYMzwb_Y2GRcg.text: I've lived in Pittsburgh long enough now that I thought it was time to try one of the most popular foods the city. I love how convenient this restaurant is and you know it's good food because it's been rated some of the top Pierogies in the city. They have a ton of options on their menu but make sure you call ahead to order if you are getting large quantities. When picking up I asked what their best sellers were and she told me definitely the potato and cheese ones. I tried them and they were great. The potato and bacon Pierogies are also very good. I like how you have the option to pick them up hot or cold and their website gives you instructions on how to properly heat and cook them multiple ways if needed. They offer some coupons online as well. Give it a try if you're in the area.

xbFS5zqWsEbvyuOIy8aOqA.text: Deep down inside I know I have a week spot for anything potatoes.  With my background, when you add dough to this mix, I get week in the knees.  I have been wanting to come here for the longest time, and finally made that a reality.  I do have to say, if you are expecting to come here and have a huge dine in experience, better rethink that.  I'm not saying that you can't, but you really can't.  Let me explain.  You order your food inside at a small counter and then you wait.  You get your food and most people literally roll out of the parking lot.  However, there is a small area outside with a few tables that you can sit at if you do not want to take it to go.  That's what we did.  It did not take very long for our food to be ready.  When I looked at my food I thought that I was given the wrong thing, but it was my fault.  I really wanted the kielbasa but my eyes played a trick on me and I got the stuffed cabbage.  I am not the biggest fan of cooked cabbage, but somehow they made it edible for me.  I really did enjoy it, but don't count on me doing that again.  What I wanted to focus on was the pierogies.  I love pierogies, and these did not disappoint.  They are huge.  I am not exaggerating on that.  These are not the pierogies you find in other area restaurants let alone the grocery store.  These were the biggest pierogies I have ever seen.  It's like they filled the palms of their hands to the brim and then wrapped it all in dough.  And whoever is doing this has some big hands.  Each bite of these I had to keep myself from rolling my eyes back in my head.  I was in heaven.  The butter and onions with each bite was amazing.  I could go back right now if I could.    If you do get it to go, they do an incredible job of wrapping this up so that it will not leak out.  In a food container, then into a clear bag and then inside another bag.  If this were to leak, then that's on you.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. The #3

agFOPzPHxlRUqsv8VfGsNQ.text: I come from a very Polish family who takes their food seriously. This place has the best pierogies I've ever tasted outside of my grandma's recipe! So many varieties, hot or cold, other Polish items and desserts! Pick up from here is quick and easy!

Anu4PGthxZEC_UBDSoIvHA.text: I have been wanting to eat here for years but when I am in "the Burgh" I am often not near it.  We ordered #1 sampler which has 4 potato pierogies, haluska and stuffed cabbage. They have a high bar because I make all 3 of them and mine are good.  Huge amount of food, fed two of us and I still have left overs.  And very good. Generally prefer other than the potato pierogies but that's what comes with the meal.   Busy place even at 11.  Reasonably priced.  More of a takeout place. They package their good well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Stuffed cabbage, pierogies, salads and rice pudding

5P1qjuVHHPrjaMhq44F5sQ.text: The minute I land in Pittsburgh, Pierogies Plus has to be my first stop. I love everything they do here and I love the huge amount of different Pierogies they have to offer. Because of them I have wandered away from my classic potato and cheese and now only get the spicy sausage pierogies. The fillings are plentiful, not to spicy, and the dough is perfect and not too thick. Prices are excellent and service window is prompt. I can think of no better place for me to stop while in Pittsburgh, Aloha

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. It feels like home
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Potato cheese pierogies
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Hunter&#39;s Stew

KHMR5yi8pg38lpcMgeDsEw.text: This place was thoroughly disappointing.  First and foremost, you can't eat in. You walk in and there is a counter you order from. I did read reviews and visited the website but it wasn't immediately evident this was more of a deli.  The service was very friendly.  There wasn't a huge selection of different pierogi flavors.  The only way I know you can get the pierogies is boiled, not fried.  They were ok but really nothing special.

YcQXMs_IEnOwILTok6uO5w.text: When my favorite pierogies stopped being sold at Costco (No they are NOT Mrs. T's) - I was upset, to say the least. "Will I ever have a decent potato, cheese & jalapeno pieorgi again?!" I thought. Then I discovered Pierogies Plus. After reading countless positive reviews, I decided to give them a try. I ordered about 4 dozen of the potato, cheese & jalapeno pierogies- I was picking them up fresh and cooking them at home. I was surprised when I first saw this place- it was so small and adorable, a real mom & pops place. The service was really friendly and my order came out perfectly. I just sauteed these bad boys in some oil, butter, and fried onions and WOW were they tasty. They are quite big and packed with flavor. We loved them. I will definitely be coming back here.  PS. They have coupons online that will save you $$ on pierogie orders- I recommend using them :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Prepared these delicious bad boys at home- jalapeno, cheddar &amp; potato pierogies

ZQ6suJ9hP8VxZ8X51Uqd4A.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh for fresh pierogies. The staff is friendly and helpful with questions.   I enjoyed the #2 sampler platter which had a generous serving of haluski along with 4 pierogies and kielbasa. I have also tried the broccoli salad and carrot cake, which were so similar to my family recipe that I felt like I was at a family reunion picnic. Keep up the good work!

t2c8yMR4d55otbr-TYR8ng.text: Came to Pittsburgh for a Steelers game. I was told in this area had a good polish food and stumbled upon Pierogies Plus. The reviews are right, this place had some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. #1 off the menu

rwLBIkcCqf94qZehVpVpZw.text: This is sort of out of range for Pittsburgh people but best pierogies I've ever had in my life. I've only had pierogies at Fuel and Fuddle in Oakland but these pierogies tasted so real. They're definitely handmade and homemade. You can taste each folded crease and it's not something you just heat up from a frozen package. There are a variety of fillings than just potatoes. We got ones with cottage cheese and chives filling and potato and cheese filling. I personally liked the potato and cheese filling more but the cottage cheese and chives filling was delicious too.   Pierogies Plus seems like a pretty well known place in that area since there was never a time without a line of people waiting to order or grab their food. There's only a couple outdoor seating because the location actually used to be a gas station. So the inside is only the kitchen and ordering place. Also parking space isn't too big.   Definitely worth driving here to get the most authentic, homemade pierogies!

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States. Cottage cheese &amp; chives filled pierogies (bottom left) and potato &amp; cheese filled pierogies (top right)

-bI-0Regu51QpjR0DUxLwg.text: Some really nice homemade pierogies. Tried the classic potatoes and cheese, and the hot sausage pierogies. There's a small area in the lot to dine there, but I recommend doing take out. Overall a really great place. I tried the haluski too, but i would go for the pierogies again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States
Photo of Pierogies Plus - McKees Rocks, PA, United States

QJRK5KTB1wuME8pr1vpKsw.text: Best cabbage rolls I've ever had! I ordered a combo: cabbage roll, potato Pierogies, and Haluski. The Pierogies were thicker than I'm used to but delicious. I thought the haluski was very salty and light on noodles; it was mostly cabbage and onion so, I would skip the haluski on the next visit.

vq_Cpm0avE6jzxsjzsRPLQ.text: I ordered the cabbage roll, potato and cheese pierogi, and haluski. ALL OF IT WAS EXCELLENT! The hot cabbage roll was so delicious! The pierogis were amazing and so plump and big! The onions were cut up nice and small. The noodles and cabbage were the best I have ever I had. A perfect blend with the cabbage nicely chopped up- and perfectly seasoned. Do not hesitate to try this place!!! You won't be disappointed!!

nLeD6YDvkM54z3BP_3VQnw.text: Whenever I travel to NC to see my son and I can make the trip over to Pierogis Plus, I always make sure to go there to get a nice batch to take. It's all he ever asks for from Pittsburgh. They are simply the best. The variety is very good, the pierogis and other traditional items like stuffed cabbage and noodles are consistent and so good, service is great and prices are so reasonable. I've never eaten there but the people I've seen doing so on the picnic tables out front seem to be enjoying themselves despite traffic whizzing by. It's worth the trip. Frozen or fresh, the food is lovely.

4SLzq_fG1AIdJERP5u0fwQ.text: Good good good! Being from out of town we didn't realize that it was not a seated restaurant so we ate in a he car. The potato/ cheese pierogi were delicious, loved the haluski and kielbasa was excellent. The counter woman was super friendly. Make the drive and enjoy!

EVA2N49Q6lRHLl1jNVopPw.text: There was a time when you insisted on getting your Pierogies from the churches. They were authentic recipes made with love by church ladies. Pierogies Plus hires church ladies, and it's a lot easier than buying from churches. Seriously, they ship Pierogies all over the world, and their product is the gold standard. Plan some extra time, because this is not fast food. The counter always seems slow to me, they do things their own way, but now I find it rather charming.   They have some coupons on their website, and there have been Groupon deals in the past, so check for those.  Bottom line, the Pierogies are amazing and authentic.

c7BVhxiXlMccjwCfy4IwhQ.text: The cutest little pierogie shop. It's owned by a polish family so they have authentic food. They have so many options and are willing to be flexible with ordering things. I got the #1 sampler which came with stuffed cabbage, haluski, and 4 pierogies(I chose 4 different flavors). Everything was amazing!! Some of the best polish food I've ever eaten. There are a few tables to sit outside if you'd like which is nice when it's warmer out.

RHkD_D_f-bEUJFJ1iQ4B0Q.text: The best pierogis I've ever had in my life! We get them every year for our St. Patrick's Day Party and people can't get enough. Ive tried a lot of pierogis over the years and these are number by a landslide.

L0w7oFm69vY78Bhw9dKwzg.text: Best pierogies in Pittsburgh, which is saying a lot. They taste like they just came out of a sweet Polish grandmother's kitchen. You can get them frozen to take home or hot to eat immediately, and they come in a lot of different flavors. I got a platter, with pierogies, halushki, and kielbasa. It was a HUGE amount of food for a good price, but everything was drenched in butter and oil (which I'm sure some people would love, but it was too much for me). The location is a little drive out of the city, and it's off the side of a road, but there are parking spots there and tables out front to eat at. Keep in mind that there's no seating inside the place, so if it's too cold outside to eat, you'll have to bring your food home.
